intro: Hebe biggarii, commonly known as the silver hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Hebe biggarii is relatively low maintenance and suitable for coastal gardens due to its tolerance of salty air.
